message.content: This question tests knowledge about the habitat of polar bears. Polar bears are native to the Arctic region, which is characterized by snowy and icy conditions. Option (A) is incorrect because deserts are dry and not suitable for polar bears. Option (C) is incorrect because polar bears are wild animals and do not live in human dwellings. Option (D) is incorrect because polar bears are adapted to cold climates and cannot survive in hot areas.

This question requires basic knowledge about the habitat and adaptability of polar bears. Polar bears are specifically adapted to living in cold, snowy areas. They have thick fur and a layer of blubber to keep them insulated in freezing temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because deserts are extremely hot and dry, which is not suitable for polar bears. Option (C) is incorrect because polar bears are wild animals, not able to live in apartments. Option (D) is incorrect because polar bears cannot survive in hot areas due to their physiological adaptations to cold climates.
